alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 4:41PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Johnson County through 515 PM MDT... At 440 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Buffalo, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Johnson County. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 275 and 291. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
